uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.heart

Class Heartbeat

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.heart.Heartbeat

  • public class Heartbeat
extends java.lang.Object
    A heartbeat is used within Palisade to send notification that a particular instance of a service exists and is alive. For example, when there are multiple instances of a particular service A, service B might wish to get a list of all current instances of service A to find out where it can send a request. This is particularly useful for service discovery and load balancing.

    When this heartbeat gets garbage collected the thread sending beats automatically terminates. Thus, the heart instance must be kept live to keep beating.

    This relies on the time to live feature provided by a CacheService to register a running instance.

    Most parameters cannot be changed whilst the heartbeats are being sent.

    No parameter may be null unless stated.

    See Also:
    Stethoscope

    • Method Detail

      • heartRate

        public Heartbeat heartRate(java.time.Duration heartRate)
        Set the duration for this heartbeat. This must be at least HeartUtil.MIN_HEARTBEAT_DURATION else an exception is thrown. You cannot change this parameter whilst the heartbeat is running.
        Parameters:
        heartRate - the new heart rate
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if heartRate is below the minimum threshold
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called while isBeating() returns true

      • setHeartRate

        public void setHeartRate(java.time.Duration heartRate)
        Set the duration for this heartbeat. This must be at least HeartUtil.MIN_HEARTBEAT_DURATION else an exception is thrown. You cannot change this parameter whilst the heartbeat is running.
        Parameters:
        heartRate - the new heart rate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if heartRate is below the minimum threshold
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called while isBeating() returns true

      • instanceName

        public Heartbeat instanceName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name for this instance. This should be a recognisable name like an IP address or a hostname or URL by which other entities can uniquely identify this instance. If the name is null then a default instance name will be generated which will normally be the local IP address of the host.
        Parameters:
        name - the instance name, if null then a default name will be generated
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is empty
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called while isBeating() returns true

      • setInstanceName

        public void setInstanceName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name for this instance. This should be a recognisable name like an IP address or a hostname or URL by which other entities can uniquely identify this instance. If the name is null then a default instance name will be generated which will normally be the local IP address of the host.
        Parameters:
        name - the instance name, if null then a default name will be generated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is empty

      • start

        public void start()
        Start sending heartbeats to the cache service. All needed parameters must be set before this method can be complete successfully. Exceptions will be thrown for unset items. Once started, most fields in this class cannot be changed until stop() is called.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a required field has not been set, or if heart beats are already active

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops sending heartbeats to the cache service.

      • isBeating

        public boolean isBeating()
        Checks if the heartbeat notifications are currently being sent.
        Returns:
        true if beats are being sent
